# Writeup for Yet Another G00913

## @u597

````
require "openssl"
require "bigdecimal/math"

max = 199
pi = BigMath::PI(1000).to_s[2..1000]
pi.length.times do |i|
  if OpenSSL::BN.new(pi[i..max + i].to_i).prime?
    puts "FLAG_Q13_#{pi[i..max + i]}"
    break
  end
end
````

## @kira924age

````
#!/usr/bin/env python2
# coding: utf-8

"""
https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Algorithm_Implementation/Mathematics/Primality_Testing
ミラーラビン素数判定法コピペしたら答え出た
"""

import random
import sys

def is_prime(n, k = 7):
    """use Rabin-Miller algorithm to return True (n is probably prime)
    or False (n is definitely composite)"""
    if n < 6:  # assuming n >= 0 in all cases... shortcut small cases here
        return [False, False, True, True, False, True][n]
    elif n & 1 == 0:  # should be faster than n % 2
        return False
    else:
        s, d = 0, n - 1
        while d & 1 == 0:
            s, d = s + 1, d >> 1
            # Use random.randint(2, n-2) for very large numbers
        for a in random.sample(xrange(2, min(n - 2, sys.maxint)), min(n - 4, k)):
            x = pow(a, d, n)
            if x != 1 and x + 1 != n:
                for r in xrange(1, s):
                    x = pow(x, 2, n)
                    if x == 1:
                        return False  # composite for sure
                    elif x == n - 1:
                        a = 0  # so we know loop didn't continue to end
                        break  # could be strong liar, try another a
                if a:
                    return False  # composite if we reached end of this loop
    return True  # probably prime if reached end of outer loop

# 1000 places of Pi
pi = "14159265358979323846264338327950288419716939937510"\
     "58209749445923078164062862089986280348253421170679"\
     "82148086513282306647093844609550582231725359408128"\
     "48111745028410270193852110555964462294895493038196"\
     "44288109756659334461284756482337867831652712019091"\
     "45648566923460348610454326648213393607260249141273"\
     "72458700660631558817488152092096282925409171536436"\
     "78925903600113305305488204665213841469519415116094"\
     "33057270365759591953092186117381932611793105118548"\
     "07446237996274956735188575272489122793818301194912"\
     "98336733624406566430860213949463952247371907021798"\
     "60943702770539217176293176752384674818467669405132"\
     "00056812714526356082778577134275778960917363717872"\
     "14684409012249534301465495853710507922796892589235"\
     "42019956112129021960864034418159813629774771309960"\
     "51870721134999999837297804995105973173281609631859"\
     "50244594553469083026425223082533446850352619311881"\
     "71010003137838752886587533208381420617177669147303"\
     "59825349042875546873115956286388235378759375195778"\
     "18577805321712268066130019278766111959092164201989"\

for i in range(801):
    num = int(pi[i:i+200])
    if is_prime(num):
        print "FLAG_Q13_" + str(num)
        break
    if i == 800:
        print "Not Found"

````

## @mpyw

````
<?php

function pistr($i, $length)
{
    static $fp;
    static $str = '';
    if (!$fp) {
        $fp = fopen('https://newton.ex.ac.uk/research/qsystems/collabs/pi/pi6.txt', 'rb');
    }
    while (!isset($str[$i + $length - 1])) {
        $line = fgets($fp);
        if ($line === false) exit(1);
        $str .= preg_replace('/[^\d]+/', '', $line);
    }
    return substr($str, $i, $length);
}

for ($i = 0 ;; ++$i) {
    $num = ltrim(pistr($i, 200), '0');
    if (gmp_prob_prime($num)) {
        echo "FLAG_Q13_$num\n";
        break;
    }
}
````

## @flo\_wing

````
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 

import random;

pistr = u"";

def test():
    i = 0
    while i + 200 < len(pistr) :
        print(i)
        subpi = int(pistr[i:i+200])
        if is_prime3(subpi):
            print(subpi)
            break
        i=i+1

# refs; http://d.hatena.ne.jp/pashango_p/20090704/1246692091
def is_prime3(q,k=50):
    q = abs(q)
    if q == 2: return True
    if q < 2 or q&1 == 0: return False

    d = (q-1)>>1
    while d&1 == 0:
        d >>= 1
    
    for i in range(k):
        a = random.randint(1,q-1)
        t = d
        y = pow(a,t,q)
        while t != q-1 and y != 1 and y != q-1: 
            y = pow(y,2,q)
            t <<= 1
        if y != q-1 and t&1 == 0:
            return False
    return True        

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test()

````

## @codehex

````
#!/usr/bin/python
# coding: UTF-8
import re # use regex

def is_prime(q): # http://d.hatena.ne.jp/pashango_p/20090704/1246692091
    q = abs(q)
    if q == 2: return True
    if q < 2 or q & 1 == 0: return False
    return pow(2, q - 1, q) == 1

set_num = 200 # digit
two_hundreds_digit = 1415926... # 200 digest of pi
num = 442881... # rear of number than two_hundreds_digit
str_num = str(num)
judge = is_prime(two_hundreds_digit)
flag = False # flag of escape from multiple loop

while not judge:
	two_hundreds_digit = str(two_hundreds_digit)
	two_hundreds_digit = re.sub(r'^[0-9]', '', two_hundreds_digit)
	while len(two_hundreds_digit) != set_num:
		two_hundreds_digit += str_num[:1]
		two_hundreds_digit = int(two_hundreds_digit)
		two_hundreds_digit = str(two_hundreds_digit)
		str_num = re.sub(r'^[0-9]', '', str_num)
		if not len(str_num): # if str_num is empty
			flag = True
			break
	if flag:
		break
	print two_hundreds_digit
	two_hundreds_digit = int(two_hundreds_digit)
	judge = is_prime(two_hundreds_digit)
	print judge

if not flag:
	print "Win!!"
else:
	print "Failed..."
````
